lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The country expected to launch up to 120 mln dlrs in floating rate notes, but the market has virtually disappeared in the past few months as supply outstripped demand and the number of market makers contracted sharply.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The floating rate note was the first such issue for Colombia, which has had limited access to the international capital markets since the eruption of the international debt crisis in 1982, despite its ability to avoid a rescheduling.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Of its planned total borrowings this year of two billion dlrs, he said that about 1.4 billion had been arranged before the end of 1986 and that most of the borrowings in 1987 will be drawn in future years.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The country expected to launch up to 120 mln dlrs in floating rate notes, but the market has virtually disappeared in the past few months as supply outstripped demand and the number of market makers contracted sharply.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The floating rate note was the first such issue for Colombia, which has had limited access to the international capital markets since the eruption of the international debt crisis in 1982, despite its ability to avoid a rescheduling.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Of its planned total borrowings this year of two billion dlrs, he said that about 1.4 billion had been arranged before the end of 1986 and that most of the borrowings in 1987 will be drawn in future years.
